content.description: It will probably be a little dirty. Lots of crimps and sloping holds.
content.location:
North Facing route.

 Continue past Tarzan, up to the left. Go down, cross the gully, and continue onward. You will come to a wall with two large cracks. Squeeze thru the crack on the right and then cross one more gully. You will climb thru another tight spot, and then down the hill to the right is the belay ledge for Winged messenger.

content.description: Goes up some very nice stone past a large flake before tackling a couple roofs then finishing on a slab.
content.location: This is the bolted route on the east side of Flying Buttress. Route is most easily accessed by the lower river trail as you hike past Ship Rock.

content.description: Start on the undercling and move directly out the large opening. A fall at any point can be extremely dangerous, but especially on the last few moves. Potential for rolling down the entire bluff and hitting a tree or going into the river if you are lucky. Not sure on difficulty. Probably between 4-7. Was climbing very tense and didn't have beta dialed.
content.location: This boulder is past ship rock and before the slot opening to flying buttress. Crawl through a tunnel on your hands and knees to see the face of the climb.

content.description: Well protected with consistent climbing to the chains
content.location: After going through the tunnel, keep your eyes on the bluff to the left and you will find it.

content.description: This wall has three rarely climbed routes. Most people that are this far into the park usually keep going to Windy Point. I only included Winged Messenger as it was the only route that had enough info to warrant an entry/only one worth climbing.
